questions.question: John, put a ........................................ in it! Can you not see that I am listening to the radio?
questions.description: 'Put a cork in it' means be quiet.

questions.question: She never missed even a single opportunity to put me ................................................ and that was the reason we decided to part ways.
questions.description: To put someone down is to criticize him or her.

questions.question: I wish you would not put your ................................................... in where it is not wanted.
questions.description: To put one's nose in is to interfere in someone's business.

questions.question: My neighbor likes to put .................................................. in front of me.
questions.description: 'To put on the dog' is to try to seem richer than you really are.

questions.question: They put him ..................................................... for fourteen years but that did not reform him.
questions.description: To put someone away is to send him or her to prison.

questions.question: Do not believe what she says. She is just putting you ..................................................!
questions.description: To put somebody on is to fool or tease him or her.

questions.question: Feel free to call me if you cannot find a good hotel. I will put you ..................................................
questions.description: To put somebody up is to provide accommodation.

questions.question: I put ...................................................... on him but that did not help because he was already broke.
questions.description: To put the bite on someone is to try to get money from him or her.

questions.question: During the identification parade, the girl put .................................................. on the man who killed her mother.
questions.description: To put the finger on somebody is to identify him or her.

questions.question: My girlfriend is putting ................................................... on me to buy her a diamond necklace.
questions.description: To put the screws on somebody is to pressure them to do something.

questions.question: He suspected that his business partner was putting ................................................. him, but he had nothing to prove it.
questions.description: To put something over on somebody is to deceive him or her.

questions.question: The hostess really put ....................................................... to see that everyone was comfortable.
questions.description: To put oneself out is to take pains to do something.
